# Filter Parameter Keys

**API Collection**

Keys for input parameters to filters.

## Overview

These keys represent some of the most commonly used input parameters. A filter can use other kinds of input parameters.

## Constants

- **kCIOutputImageKey**: A key for the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object produced by a filter.
- **kCIInputAmountKey**
- **kCIInputBackgroundImageKey**: A key for the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object to use as a background image.
- **kCIInputImageKey**: A key for the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object to use as an input image. For filters that also use a background image, this key refers to the foreground image.
- **kCIInputTimeKey**: Specify a time.
- **kCIInputDepthImageKey**: A key for an image with depth values.
- **kCIInputDisparityImageKey**: A key for an image with disparity values.
- **kCIInputTransformKey**: Transformation to apply.
- **kCIInputScaleKey**: The amount of scale to apply.
- **kCIInputAspectRatioKey**: Aspect Ratio.
- **kCIInputCenterKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIVector] object that specifies the center of the area, as *x*  and  *y*- coordinates, to be filtered.
- **kCIInputRadiusKey**: The distance from the center of an effect.
- **kCIInputAngleKey**: The angle.
- **kCIInputRefractionKey**: The index of refraction to use.
- **kCIInputWidthKey**: A key for a scalar value that specifies the width of the effect.
- **kCIInputSharpnessKey**: Amount of sharpening to apply.
- **kCIInputIntensityKey**: An intensity value.
- **kCIInputEVKey**: How many F-stops brighter or darker the image should be.
- **kCIInputSaturationKey**: The amount to adjust the saturation.
- **kCIInputColorKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColor] object that specifies a color value.
- **kCIInputBrightnessKey**: Brightness level.
- **kCIInputContrastKey**: A contrast level.
- **kCIInputWeightsKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIVector] object that describes a weight matrix for use with a convolution filter.
- **kCIInputGradientImageKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object that specifies an environment map with alpha. Typically, this image contains highlight and shadow.
- **kCIInputMaskImageKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object to use as a mask.
- **kCIInputMatteImageKey**
- **kCIInputShadingImageKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object  that specifies an environment map with alpha values. Typically this image contains highlight and shadow.
- **kCIInputTargetImageKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIImage] object that is the target image for a transition.
- **kCIInputExtentKey**: A key for a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIVector] object that specifies a rectangle that defines the extent of the effect.
- **kCIInputVersionKey**: Version Key
- **standard**: Use Standard dynamic range.
- **constrainedHigh**: Use extended dynamic range, but brightness is modulated to optimize for co-existence with other composited content.
- **high**: Use High dynamic range.
- **baselineExposure**: The amount of baseline exposure applied.
- **disableGamutMap**: Whether or not to disable gamut mapping.
- **moireAmount**: The amount of moiré reduction to apply.

## Constants

- **Filter Attribute Keys**: Attributes for a filter and its parameters.
- **Data Type Attributes**: Numeric data types.
- **Vector Quantity Attributes**: Vector data types.
- **Color Attribute Keys**: Color types.
- **Image Attribute Keys**: Image Types
- **Filter Category Keys**: Categories of filters.
- **Options for Applying a Filter**: Options that control the application of a custom Core Image filter.
- **User Interface Control Options**: Sets of controls for various user scenarios.
- **User Interface Options**: Keys or values for the size of the input parameter controls for a filter view.
- **RAW Image Options**: Options for creating a [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIFilter-swift.class] object from RAW image data.
